page.title: 03THE WEY AND ARUN CANAL.
page.content: { The Wey and Arun Canal}was built in three years. It was opened on the 29th September 1816. It started at Shalford, passed through Bramley, Cranleigh and Elmbridge to Loxwood, Drungewick and Pulborough. The canal quickly fell out of use because more technical vehicles were being used. There are ten locks and three aquaducts which need a lot of repairing. The land around the canal is heavily overgrown. There is lots of Cow Parsley, Stitchwort and Herb Robert. {The Wey and Arun Canal Trust}is trying to repair the canal and is raising money for this purpose. A new bridge has been built at Loxwood. {The Wey South Path,}linking the North and South Downs follows the canal.
